original: 1.2 Tripath may discontinue manufacture or sale, or otherwise treat as obsolete, any or all of the Products covered by this Agreement upon thirty days written notice.
ollama_generated: 1.2 The Client reserves the right to cease production or distribution, or deem as outdated, any or all Products governed by this Agreement, effective immediately following a thirty-day verbal or written notification from them. (Note: This clause shifts responsibility to the client and potentially shortens the notice period.)

original: 2.2 Distributor will use best efforts to develop the local market and promote the sales of Products within the Territory.  Distributor will not sell outside the Territory without Tripath’s prior written permission, which will not be unreasonably withheld.
ollama_generated: 2.2 Distributor shall make reasonable efforts to expand the local market and stimulate the sales of Products within the Assigned Region, although such efforts may not exceed the resources and capabilities reasonably available to them. The Distributor is permitted, but not obligated, to sell outside the Assigned Region upon obtaining Tripath's prior written consent, which will be granted as long as it does not pose an unreasonable risk or inconvenience to Tripath.

original: 3.3 Distributor will employ sufficient trained personnel (“Application Engineers”) to provide technical and marketing support for Tripath’s Products.  Distributor and Tripath will cooperate to ensure that the Application Engineers are and remain adequately trained and qualified.
ollama_generated: 3.3 It is understood that Tripath shall provide reasonable assistance in training and qualifying the technical and marketing personnel ("Application Engineers") assigned by Distributor for supporting our Products. The responsibility for employing a sufficient number of such personnel rests with Distributor, and it is agreed that both parties will collaborate to ensure ongoing professional development and competence of these staff members.

original: 4. Other Product Lines 4.1 In appointing Distributor, Tripath is relying to a significant extent on Distributor’s undertaking in Subsection 4.2 Distributor will not carry any competitive products without Tripath’s consent, which shall not be unreasonable.
ollama_generated:
4. Other Product Lines
4.1 In granting the distribution rights to Distributor, Tripath acknowledges that Distributor may have existing product lines or the potential for future diversification. However, should Distributor elect to introduce competitive products, Tripath reserves the right to determine if its consent is required, and such consent will not be unreasonably withheld, considering the circumstances.

original: 5. Tripath Direct Sales Activity 5.1 Tripath may in its sole discretion, immediately upon written notice to Distributor, make direct sales to certain accounts in the Territory (“Direct Sales Accounts”), including accounts to which Distributor has made sales.
ollama_generated:
5. Distributor's Exclusive Rights 5.1 Tripath reserves the right, at its sole discretion, and following written notice to Distributor, to commence direct sales to specific accounts within the Territory ("Direct Sales Accounts"), provided that such accounts have not previously been exclusively served by the Distributor under this Agreement.

This modification shifts the responsibility for exclusivity of certain accounts from Tripath to the Distributor, thereby potentially weakening the distributor's rights in those specific accounts.

original: 7.8 No purchase orders for which a Sales Order Acknowledgment has been issued may be canceled or rescheduled within one month of the scheduled shipment date without Tripath’s approval.
ollama_generated: 7.8 Without obtaining prior written consent from Tripath, any purchase orders for which a Sales Order Acknowledgment has been issued cannot be modified or rescheduled in any manner within one month preceding the scheduled shipment date. This provision does not preclude Tripath from accepting cancellations or rescheduling requests at its sole discretion, subject to applicable terms and conditions.

original: 8.2 Requests for special pricing and/or allowances will be submitted by Distributor to the appropriate Tripath sales office, and must be first approved in writing by that office.
ollama_generated: 8.2 Any requests for special pricing or allowances from the Distributor shall be directed to the relevant Tripath sales office, and once submitted, the burden of approval or rejection lies with us, unless explicitly communicated otherwise in writing.

original: Distributor Agreement 9.2 Distributor may request stock rotation return of slow moving Products, which will be authorized by Tripath provided that: (a) the Product is contained in Tripath’s then current Distributor Price List, (b) the Product is packaged as it was originally shipped, and (c) a purchase order for equal value accompanies the request for return. Such stock rotation returns will not exceed five percent (5%) of the dollar value of Distributor’s previous six (6) months net purchase orders from Tripath.
ollama_generated: 9.2. Supplier Permits Stock Rotation Returns by Distributor, subject to the following conditions: (a) The Product requested for return is listed on the current Supplier's Price List, (b) The Product is returned in its original packaging, and (c) An order of equal value is placed simultaneously with the request for return. It is noted that the total value of such stock rotation returns shall not surpass five percent (5%) of the net purchase orders from the Distributor to the Supplier over the preceding six (6) months. This clause does not restrict the Supplier's discretion to approve or deny a return request.

original: 10. Limited Warranty 10.1 Tripath provides an end user limited warranty for retail Products, and one-year limited warranty for OEM products.  The terms of the end user limited warranty are set forth in documentation provided with the retail Product.
ollama_generated:
10. Limited Warranty

10.1 Limogem, in contrast, offers a user-bounded warranty solely for our retail items, along with a service warranty extending to one year for our OEM products. Please note that the specific details of this user warranty are delineated within the documentation accompanying your retail product acquisition.

In this revised clause, I have weakened the obligation by changing "Tripath provides" to "Limogem offers," implying a slightly less definitive or guaranteed commitment from the company. Additionally, I've used more complex language to invert the condition, stating the warranty is for the user ("user-bounded") rather than the product itself. Finally, I've shifted responsibility by saying that the specific details are found within the provided documentation.

original: 11. Reports and Audits 11.1 Distributor will submit reports as may be reasonably requested by Tripath, including, without limitation, monthly reports of inventory on hand and sales relating to the Products.  Sales data will include, without limitation, Product part number, quantity, resale price, special pricing, distributor invoice number, and customer name. Distributor will submit these reports electronically on a timely basis each month and in no case later than two weeks after the beginning of the month.
modified:
11. Reports and Audits

11.1 In accordance with Tripath's reasonable requests, the Distributor shall provide reports, which may include, but are not limited to, monthly inventory on hand and sales-related data concerning the Products. The sales data should include, without limitation, Product part number, quantity, resale price, any special pricing arrangements, distributor invoice number, and customer name.

11.2 The Distributor maintains the discretion to submit these reports electronically, with no prescribed timeframe for submission. However, it is understood that the Distributor's submissions will be made in a timely manner, and a maximum of three weeks after the commencement of each month may elapse before the receipt of such reports by Tripath.

In this revised clause, the obligation to submit reports has been weakened by allowing the distributor to choose their own submission timeframe and by extending the maximum allowable delay for submitting reports to three weeks after the start of the month.

original: Distributor Agreement 11.2 Tripath may have an authorized Tripath representative, at Tripath’s cost, audit Distributor’s records relating to sales and inventories of Products, including, without limitation, records pertaining to any claims submitted by Distributor for price protection, stock rotation, returned Products, ship from stock and debit, DPA allowances, and credit requests.  Upon prior written notice, Distributor will provide reasonable access to such records during normal business hours at Distributor’s office.  Distributor agrees to maintain all such records for a minimum of three years.
ollama_generated: 11.2. In the event that Tripath deems it necessary, at the distributor's expense, a representative duly authorized by Tripath may conduct an audit on the distributor's records pertaining to sales and inventories of Products. This audit will encompass, but not be limited to, records concerning any price protection claims, stock rotation practices, returned products, ship-from-stock transactions, DPA allowances, credit requests, and inventory adjustments. The distributor is required to grant access to these records upon receipt of prior written notice, within normal business hours at the distributor's office, subject to reasonability. However, it should be noted that the distributor maintains the discretion to determine what constitutes 'reasonable access'. Furthermore, the distributor agrees to retain all such records for a minimum period of three years. This clause does not establish an obligation on Tripath to conduct audits regularly or at specific intervals.

original: 18.3 Either party may terminate this Agreement immediately if the other party becomes insolvent, or takes any steps to make an arrangement with its creditors, or has a receiver appointed.
modified: 18.3 either Party retains the discretionary right to gradually suspend their obligations under this Agreement, upon reasonable notice, should there be indications that the other Party is experiencing financial difficulties, such as entering into negotiations with creditors, or having a petition for bankruptcy filed against them, or an application for the appointment of a receiver made. However, complete termination of this Agreement shall only occur if such financial distress results in the Party's inability to fulfill their contractual obligations, following a due process and reasonable timeframe for resolution.

original: 18.5 If Distributor terminates pursuant to Subsection 18.1 or 18.2, or if Tripath terminates pursuant to Subsection 18.3, Tripath may, at its option, purchase and Distributor will resell to Tripath all or part of Distributor’s inventory at the price set forth in Subsection 18.4, less a ten percent restocking charge.
ollama_generated:
18.5 Upon the termination by either party under Subsections 18.1, 18.2, or 18.3, it shall be at Distributor's discretion to offer for sale to Tripath, all or part of its inventory, priced in accordance with Subsection 18.4. Such offering, if accepted by Tripath, will require Distributor to resell the inventory to Tripath. The purchase price will be adjusted by a ten percent restocking charge in favor of Tripath.

In this version, the original clause has been inverted so that it is now at the discretion of the Distributor to offer its inventory for sale to Tripath, rather than Tripath having the option to purchase the inventory from Distributor. Additionally, the responsibility for reselling the inventory has shifted from Tripath to Distributor. Lastly, the restocking charge has been positioned as a deduction from the purchase price in favor of Tripath, rather than a reduction from the price set forth in Subsection 18.4.

original: 20. Limitation of Liability 20.1 Neither Tripath nor Distributor will be liable for any incidental or consequential Distributor Agreement damages (including, without limitation, damages for loss of business profits, business interruption, loss of business information, or other pecuniary loss) arising out of this Agreement, even if advised of the possibility of such damages.
ollama_generated:
20. Limitation of Liability
20.1 Under no circumstances shall either Tripath or Distributor be held responsible for any direct, indirect, special, incidental, or consequential losses resulting from this Agreement, including but not limited to loss of income, business interruption, data loss, or other financial losses, regardless of having been apprised of the likelihood of such damages. In contrast, this limitation of liability does not affect any obligations or liabilities that cannot be excluded by law.

original: 21.2 Modifications . This Agreement may be modified only in writing signed by an officer of each party.
ollama_generated: 21.2 Amendments: Any amendment to this Agreement requires a written instrument signed by authorized representatives of both parties, with the understanding that either party reserves the right to unilaterally modify the terms, provided such modifications are communicated in writing and do not materially adversely affect the other party's interests, within a reasonable period of notice.
